answers.answer: Immaculate conception?  Um, maybe I shouldn't type that because God might zap me with a lightning bolt for that one...Anything is possible.  Maybe something got "temporarily" knocked loose?According to Wikipedia,http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Essure"For the Essure method, 3 months after insertion a physician performs a special type of x-ray test called a hysterosalpingogram to confirm that the fallopian tubes are completely blocked and the patient can rely on the Essure micro-inserts for birth control. Occlusion is observed to have occurred in 96.5% of patients at 3 months with the remainder occluded by 6 months.[1]"Not sure how you would find a better doctor... but sounds like the docs you have aren't answering your questions or looking into them.  You didn't say what kind of pain and complications your wife is having, but if her doctor is not properly addressing them, that is not a good thing.  Problem with doctors is if you don't stay on top of them and question everything and make them do their jobs, it seems they want to forget about you after you walk out the door and your file is closed and filed away.  Her OBGYN might be able to follow up with some of the doctors and demand answers.  WHat matters is that she has a healthy remainder of the pregnancy, and a healthy delivery.COngrats on the next baby.  :)

Um, the fetal echocardiogram ... why do they want to do it?You can check out the web site at:http://www.americanheart.org/presenter.jhtml?identifier=3005386Echocardiograms are sonograms.  If there is a possibility of heart problems, a detailed fetal echocardiogram can be done.  At least that is what the website above says.  Again, I'm not a doctor, a nurse, or any medical person.  Just had been through diabetes while pregnant, and wanted to offer some help.  I know it's frustrating and scary with the complications.  My worst thing was gaining the 90 pounds and then having blood sugar problems go way out of control at the last month (was induced at 37 weeks... but I did make it to 37 weeks, so that was truly a blessing).
